comments:
Tries to load the ArtifactEdit model of the new 2.5 Web project....

gets a npe....
Moving this to WTP 1.5.4  - I have seen this just importing EAR's with webservices included....  We need this fixed in 1.5.4 - looks like a null check....

Its not a not a NPE,  infact in 

WebServicesManager.getWorkspace14ServiceRefs(List)

calls artifactEdit.getContentModelRoot which throws an emf exception

By the way Chuck, what is the 1.5.4 scenario here, can you send me the ear file.

Hi Chuck, 

The method WebServicesManager.getWorkspace14ServiceRefs needs to check if the j2ee level of the project is 14 or greater.

For the time being, in WTP 2.0 it will only check if the j2ee level is 14 (NOT Greater) as we do not have model support for jee 15.

Created an attachment (id=62816)
patch for WTP 2.0

Created an attachment (id=62817)
patch for WTP 154

Approve this fix and have checked the patch dated 2007-04-03 14:53 into the 2.0 stream.  

Raj, could you add a comment about the testing you have done for the PMC.
I tested it with j2ee projects of levels 14, 13 and 12 (both wtp 2.0 & wtp 154) as well as the jee projects (for WTP 2.0) and found that the WebServicesManager did not throw any exceptions.
checked in patch dated 2007-04-03 14:50 to 1.5.4 stream.
